noun.definition: The action or process of collecting someone or something.
noun.example: The collection of refuse is done on Tuesdays.

noun.definition: A group of things or people.
noun.example: He has a rare collection of coins.

verb.definition: Bring or gather together (things, typically when scattered or widespread).
verb.example: She collected sticks to make a fire.

verb.definition: Call for and receive (something, typically money or payment).
verb.example: They are collecting donations for charity.

usage_examples: The museum has a fine collection of modern art.
She added a new doll to her collection.
